thread.title: Dangal box office collection day 18: Aamir Khan’s film earns Rs 180.58 crore at the overseas market
thread.title_full: Dangal box office collection day 18: Aamir Khan’s film earns Rs 180.58 crore at the overseas market

author: Karan Shah
title: Dangal box office collection day 18: Aamir Khan’s film earns Rs 180.58 crore at the overseas market
text:
2016 Year end special: Aamir Khan’s Dangal, Ranbir Kapoor’s Ae Dil Hai Mushkil – take a look at BEST movies this year 
Aamir Khan ‘s Dangal is currently on a magical run. The movie continues to rake in the moolah at both domestic and overseas BO and on day 18, it took its total tally to Rs 180.58 crore at the international box office. Trade analyst Taran Adarsh revealed to us more details about this when he tweeted that Dangal ‘s overseas collection till Sunday was $ 26.47 million (Rs 180.58 cr). 
Looking at the detailed break up, we figure that Dangal has crossed the 11 million mark at the North American box office. The cumulative collections of the movie in that region currently stands at USD 11.13 Million (Rs 75.94 crore). It has also grossed USD 7.51 million (Rs 51.24 crore) at the Gulf box office, while it has collected USD 3.66 million (Rs 24.97 crore) at the UK market. And at the Australian box office, it has collected USD 2.45 million (Rs 16.72 crore). ALSO READ – 5 reasons why Aamir Khan’s Dangal became the biggest blockbuster of Indian cinema 
Considering the film was released in a limited screen space (just 1000 screens abroad), the film has done very well. And even though a few films have released in the international markets, Dangal will still continue to rake in the money. This is courtesy the strong word of mouth publicity that is working in the movie’s favour. In fact, people are still going to theatres to watch the film. And with the film running for one more week, we think Dangal will end with a lifetime overseas collection of Rs 185-Rs 190 crore. ALSO READ – Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif’s Tiger Zinda Hai is a THREAT to Dangal and PK’s records, suggests trade expert 
At the domestic box office, Dangal has performed phenomenally. It has earned Rs 345.30 crore in just 17 days, making it the highest grossing Bollywood film ever. Anyway, stay tuned to BollywoodLife as we get you all the box office updates and hottest scoops right here! Published: January 9, 2017 7:14 pm Topics:
